description: From want +‎ -ful. Compare wishful, wistful, etc.

adjectives.description: wantful (comparative more wantful, superlative most wantful)

entries.meaning: Full of want or lack; lacking; poor.
examples: Nor rank, nor wealth, I ask, but let me be Above contempt, and wantful poverty.

entries.meaning: Full of want or desire; desirous.
examples: Greaves's soul had up to that moment been "wantful, lustful,” and "working actively in lower regions,” but now it became “receptive of Spirit from the higher elements.
